content.data: What's New in Solid Version 5.0

Click the links below to get more information on these new features. For quick demonstrations of these new features you can visit the  Cabinet Vision Version 5  area of the  Cabinet Vision YouTube Channel .
YouTube.png
Assembly Level

General

New Look And Feel (New Product Icon, Splash, and Buttons) 
 
 
 New User Interface (Change from Menus and Toolbars to Ribbonbars) 
 
 
 Option to Change Style of User Interface 
 
 
 Tooltips for Objects in Catalog Sidebar 
 
 
 Quick Unit Switch to Statusbar Menu 
 
 
 Exposed Grid On/Off Toggle in Statusbar Menu 
 
 
 Exposed Reset Snap Marks Option in Statusbar Menu 
 
 
 Exposed All Snap Options in Statusbar Menu 
 
 
 Combined Warnings, Views, Auto-Fill, Units, & AutoSave Utilities into a Single Preferences Utility 
 
 
 Segmented Measure and Snap Marks tool into one Single selection Drop Down option 
 
 
 Rooms, Cabinets, Closets, Counter Tops, Molding Property Options now a Single Selection 
 
 
 Layer Schedule Selector As a Text Drop Down to Easily See Your Current Layer Selection 
 
 
 Added Drawing Sheet Navigation Arrow Options 
 
 
 New Drawing Now Separate Option from the Drawing Sheet Selector 
 
 
 Added Quick "Hide All"/"Unhide All" Scenes Toggle Option 
 
 
 Shape Editor Tools Moved from Sidebar to Ribbonbar 
 
 
 CAD Tools Moved from Sidebar to Ribbonbar 
 
 
 Manual Grain Matching Functionality 
 
 
 Automated Grain Match Grouping 
 
 
 Option to Reverse Scroll Wheel Zooming 
 
 
 Disabled Auto-Zoom After Shaping a Part 
 
 
 Disabled Auto-Zoom After Changing an Objects Size 
 
 
 Remove Multiple Overrides at Override Warning Screen Using Standard Windows Selection 
 
 
 System Parameters Now Handled by Update Job Utility 
 
 
 Divided the Save Assembly "Preserve Size" in Two: "Preserve Height" and "Preserve Depth" 
 
 
 Select Multiple Jobs at Once For Batching 
 
 
 Batch Jobs Interface Redesign (Created a new Solid Batch Mode) 
 
 
 Selected Objects Parameters Tab Will Show Which UCS is Modifying a Parameter 
 
 
 Right Click Drag to Zoom In and Out in 3D Views (If you do not have a Scroll Wheel Mouse) 
 
 
 Import Google SketchUp 3D Models (.SKP) 
 
 
 Measure/Distance Results Active for Clipboard Copy in Sidebar
New Look And Feel (New Product Icon, Splash, and Buttons)

content.data: Layout (Room) Level

Room Navigation Arrow Options to Room Selector 
 
 
 New Room Now a Separate Option from the Room Selector 
 
 
 Converted Lock/Unlock Assembly Number Options into a Single Click Toggle 
 
 
 Added Toggle for Wall Face/Back to Filter List in Elevation Selector 
 
 
 Floors Added to Sidebar which Functions Similar to Counter Tops and Moldings 
 
 
 Option to Add Multiple Floors to a Single Room 
 
 
 Control the Thickness of Each Floor 
 
 
 Control Elevation of Each Floor 
 
 
 Select Different Textures for Each Floor 
 
 
 Option to Show All Hidden Walls 
 
 
 Wall Navigation Arrows Are Now Looped 
 
 
 Double Click a Wall in Plan View Takes You to That Wall's Elevation 
 
 
 Alt+Double Click on Cabinet in Elevation Does Opposite of Setting 
 
 
 Name and Number of Selected Cabinet Show in Sidebar 
 
 
 Delete All Counter Tops in a Room 
 
 
 Delete All Molding in a Room 
 
 
 Delete Multiple Rooms At Once 
 
 
 Molding, Counter Tops, and Decorative Objects are Ignored When Laying Out A Room 
 
 
 Draw a Wall Attached to the Face of Another (T-Wall/Stub Wall)
